title: Bug 118780: Expression builder displays old column name instead of alias in dataset selection
EB: When selecting the dataset in the expression builder and double clicking the first column name, the expected behavior is that the alias name is used in the expression. However, the actual behavior is that the original column name is displayed below the expression builder and the alias name appears as 'row["column1"]' above the expression builder.
SR:
Bug 118780: Expression builder displays old column name instead of alias in dataset selection

Description:
1. Create a new datasource and a dataset.
2. Set an alias for the first column in the dataset to "column1".
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder.
5. Select the dataset.
6. Double click the first column name in the expression builder.

Expected behavior:
According to scr 78193 in tracker, the first column in the expression builder should use the alias name instead of the original name.

Actual behavior:
The original name of the first column is listed below the expression builder, but the alias name appears as 'row["column1"]' above the expression builder after double clicking the original name.
